class SXF_AcceleratorReader

Interface

Public Members
virtual ~SXF_AcceleratorReader()
virtual int open(const char* acceleratorName)
virtual void close()
virtual int openSequence(const char* sequenceName)
virtual SXF_Sequence* getSequence()
virtual void closeSequence()
virtual int openElement(const char* elementType, const char* elementName)
virtual SXF_Element* getElement()
virtual void closeElement()
SXF_OStream& echo()
Protected Members
SXF_AcceleratorReader(SXF_OStream& out, int stackSize = 20)

Description

The AcceleratorReader class defines the SXF front end accelerator reader interface. According to the SXF object model, Accelerator is a root node in the hierarchical tree of sequences and elements. The SXF supports all SIF/MAD element types. However, the SXF open model allows description (and inclusion) of arbitrary element types (e.g. Muon Collider Ionization Cooling, CESR superimposed solenoid and quadrupole elements, LHC and CESR parasitic beam-beam effects, and others). To support this feature, the front end framework provides the node registry that can be adapted to particular project, site, or accelerator program. This registry must be defined in the Your_Accelerator class: 

    Your_AcceleratorReader::Your_AcceleratorReader(SXF::OStream& out, ...) 
      : SXF::AcceleratorReader(out) 
    {
      m_pNodeRegistry = Your_NodeRegistry::getInstance(...);
    }

Member Description

virtual ~SXF_AcceleratorReader()

Destructor.

virtual int open(const char* acceleratorName)

Prepare an accelerator reader for operations. Push a root sequence reader to the stack and make it current. Return SXF_TRUE or SXF_FALSE.

virtual void close()

Return an accelerator reader to its initial conditions.

virtual int openSequence(const char* sequenceName)

Push a sequence reader to the stack and make it current. Return SXF_TRUE or SXF_FALSE.

virtual SXF_Sequence* getSequence()

Return a current sequence reader.

virtual void closeSequence()

Close a current sequence reader and pop it from the stack.

virtual int openElement(const char* elementType, const char* elementName)

Select an element reader and make it current. Return SXF_TRUE or SXF_FALSE.

virtual SXF_Element* getElement()

Return a current element reader.

virtual void closeElement()

Close a current element reader.

SXF_OStream& echo()

Return OStream.

SXF_AcceleratorReader(SXF_OStream& out, int stackSize = 20)

Constructor.
